enb_long_title: Eighth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change
sentences: Parties met for the sixteenth sessions of the subsidiary bodies from 5-14 June 2002, in Bonn.
The meeting considered a range of issues previously left off the agenda due to the pressing BAPA negotiations.
Views on the direction of the climate process varied greatly, with some Parties looking backward to recent debates and others looking ahead toward the next commitment period.

Many expressed their hope that the Protocol would enter into force by the August 2002 World Summit on Sustainable Development (WSSD), with the EU and Japan announcing their ratifications just prior to SB-16.
Several draft decisions were agreed and forwarded to COP-8.
